newsitem.title: UK: Eight "Eurosceptics" attack working week ruling.
newsitem.headline: Eight "Eurosceptics" attack working week ruling.

text.p: Eight "Eurosceptic" Conservative members of parliament on Tuesday condemned the European Court ruling against Britain as a "constitutional outrage" which could plunge Britain into "the nightmare of high unemployment".

The eight said Britain should react to the European Court's rejection of Britain's challenge to a 48-hour working week rule by either repealing laws giving the European Court powers over British legislation or by blocking all EU business.
The statement was signed by MPs Teddy Taylor, Teresa Gorman, Richard Shepherd, Richard Body, Christoper Gill, Tony Marlow, Nicholas Budgen and John Wilkinson.

The eight were stripped of their membership of the ruling Conservative parliamentary party a year ago for rebelling against British Prime Minister John Major over Europe. They were welcomed back after several months.

The eight said Tuesday's ruling was "a devious and scandalous ploy to force the UK to adopt social laws which will, if unchallenged, place the nation into the nightmare of high unemployment which the other Euro nations have forced on themselves".

They said Brussels had no right to bring in such a directive under health and safety rules. "In our view the decision has created a massive open door by stretching a harmless clause to include a wide area of social legislation," they said.
